conclusion: An ideal gas undergoes processes A→B, B→C, and C→A, returning to state A.
The process A→B is an isochoric (constant volume) process, indicated by the vertical line in the diagram.
According to the ideal gas law, PV=nRT.
Since volume is constant in an isochoric process, pressure and temperature are directly proportional.
Pressure at state A is 1×10^5 Pa and temperature at state A is 200K.
Pressure at state B is 4×10^5 Pa.
Use P1/T1 = P2/T2 to find temperature at state B.
The temperature of the gas at state B is 800K.
